Idiom
pull/haul yourself up by the/your (own) bootstraps
to improve your situation or become more successful, without help from others or without advantages that others have: His father had bootstrapped himself out of rural poverty to earn a university degree in business. Nolan bootstrapped himself into the film business, cobbling together bits of 16-millimetre film stock with $6,000 to make his first feature.

to start a business, especially an internet one, with little money: He bootstrapped the company, pouring all his energy into it. I met a young engineer who had bootstrapped a company to offer mobile internet advertising services to brands.
